summary.para: Adds a file or directory described by the object to the file system image.

param.name: item
param.para: An interface of the or to add to the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Path '%1!s!' is badly formed or contains invalid characters.
Cannot read data from stream supplied for file '%1!ls!'.
Attempt to add '%1!ls!' failed: cannot create a file-system-specific unique name for the %2!ls! file system.
Adding '%1!ls!' would result in a result image having a size larger than the current configured limit.
ISO9660 is limited to 8 levels of directories.
This file system image has too many directories for the %1!ls! file system.
The directory '%1!s!' not found in FileSystemImage hierarchy.
This file or directory is not part of the file system. It must be added to complete this operation.
FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.
Adding this file or directory would result in a result image having a size larger than the current configured limit.
Failed to allocate the required memory.

returns.para: Note Values returned by the IUnknown.QueryInterface method may also be returned here.

remarks.para: To create a directory item or file item, call the or method, respectively.
Once an item is added to the file system image, the property becomes read-only.

summary.para: Adds a directory to the file system image.

param.name: path
param.para: String that contains the relative path of directory to create.
Specify the full path when calling this method from the root directory item.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Path '%1!s!' is badly formed or contains invalid characters.
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.

item.description:
ls!' is not part of the file system. It must be added to complete this operation.
Value: 0xC0AAB10B

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.

remarks.para: The parent directory for the new subdirectory must already exist within the file system image.

summary.para: Adds a file to the file system image.

param.name: path
param.para: String that contains the relative path of the directory to contain the new file.
Specify the full path when calling this method from the root directory item.

param.name: fileData
param.para: An IStream interface of the file (data stream) to write to the media.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Path '%1!s!' is badly formed or contains invalid characters.
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.

item.description:
ls!' is not part of the file system. It must be added to complete this operation.
Value: 0xC0AAB10B

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.

remarks.para: The directory that will contain the new file must already exist within the file system image.

summary.para: Adds the contents of a directory tree to the file system image.

param.name: sourceDirectory
param.para: String that contains the relative path of the directory tree to create.
Specify the full path when calling this method from the root directory item.

param.name: includeBaseDirectory
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to include the directory in sourceDirectory as a subdirectory in the file system image. Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Failed to allocate the required memory.
Failure enumerating files in the directory tree is inaccessible due to permissions.
One or more of the files in the directory tree is inaccessible due to permissions.
Cannot read data from stream supplied for file '%1!ls!'.
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.

item.description:
ls!' is not part of the file system. It must be added to complete this operation.
Value: 0xC0AAB10B

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.
Adding this file or directory would result in a result image having a size larger than the current configured limit.
Path '%1!s!' is badly formed or contains invalid characters.
Attempt to add '%1!ls!' failed: cannot create a file-system-specific unique name for the %2!ls! file system.
ISO9660 is limited to 8 levels of directories.
This file system image has too many directories for the %1!ls! file system.
The directory '%1!s!' not found in FileSystemImage hierarchy.

returns.para: Note Values returned by the and functions may also be returned here.

remarks.para: The parent directory for the new subdirectory must already exist within the file system image.
The subdirectory structure within specified source directory is implicitly mirrored in the file system image.

If file or directory collisions occur, the content of the specified source directory prevails. The file system image is overwritten with the appropriate directories and files from the source directory.
If an exception occurs during processing, the file system image reverts to its previous state.

summary.para: Number of child items in the enumeration.

param.name: Count
param.para: Number of directory and file items within the directory in the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves a list of child items contained within the directory in the file system image.

param.name: NewEnum
param.para: An interface that contains a collection of the child directory and file items contained within the directory.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: This property returns the same results as the property and is meant for use by C/C++ applications.

summary.para: Retrieves the specified directory or file item from file system image.

param.name: path
param.para: String that contains the path to the item to retrieve.

param.name: item
param.para: An interface of the requested directory or file item.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Path '%1!s!' is badly formed or contains invalid characters.
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Cannot find item %1!ls! in FileSystemImage hierarchy.

remarks.para: To determine whether the item is a file item or directory item, call the method passing __uuidof(IFsiDirectoryItem) as the interface identifier. If the call succeeds, the item is a directory item; otherwise, the item is a file item.
To enumerate all children, call the method.

summary.para: Retrieves a list of child items contained within the directory in the file system image.

param.name: NewEnum
param.para: An IEnumVariant interface that you use to enumerate the child items contained within the directory. The items of the enumeration are variants whose type is VT_BSTR. Use the bstrVal member to retrieve the path to the child item.

returns.para: S_OK is returned when the number of requested elements (celt) are returned successfully or the number of returned items (pceltFetched) is less than the number of requested elements. The celt and pceltFetched parameters are defined by IEnumVariant.
Other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: The enumeration is a snapshot of the children contained in the directory at the time of the call and will not reflect children that are added and removed.
To retrieve a single item, see the property.

summary.para: Removes the specified item from the file system image.

param.name: path
param.para: String that contains the relative path of the item to remove. The path is relative to current directory item.
Specify the full path when calling this method from the root directory item.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: Path '%1!s!' is badly formed or contains invalid characters.
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.

item.description:
ls!' is not part of the file system. It must be added to complete this operation.
Value: 0xC0AAB10B

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.

remarks.para: This method is only callable on directory items present in the file system image.

summary.para: Remove the specified directory tree from the file system image.

param.name: path
param.para: String that contains the name of directory to remove. The path is relative to current directory item.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: The path parameter is not a valid pointer.
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Path '%1!s!' is badly formed or contains invalid characters.

item.description:
ls!' is not part of the file system. It must be added to complete this operation.
Value: 0xC0AAB10B

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.
The specified directory does not exist.
Specified path %1!ls! does not identify a directory.

remarks.para: The directory item must be present in the file system image.
You can delete the entire file-system image by calling this method for the root directory item and setting the path to a single path delimiter (\).

summary.para: Use this interface to add items to or remove items from the file-system image.
To get this interface, call the method.

remarks.para: Each directory item contains an enumerable collection of child items within the directory.
You can add and remove files and directories only after the directory item has been added to the file system image.
This is an FsiDirectoryItem object in script.
